fabric.common

Class SysUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • fabric.common.SysUtil

  • public final class SysUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Convenience class containing generally useful methods such as functional programming idioms and hashing methods.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • hashPlatformClass

        public static byte[] hashPlatformClass(java.lang.Class<?> c)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Generates a cryptographically secure hash of a platform class.
        Parameters:
        c - the Class object for a class that is not stored in Fabric. If it's a Fabric class, this is the interface corresponding to the Fabric type, and not the _Proxy or _Impl classes.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • hashFClass

        public static byte[] hashFClass(ClassRef.FabricClassRef fcr)
        Returns the class hash for the Fabric class referred by the given FabricClassRef.

      • getImplClass

        public static java.lang.Class<? extends Object._Impl> getImplClass(java.lang.Class<? extends Object> clazz)
        Returns the _Impl class for the given Fabric class.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the Class object for a Fabric class. This is the interface corresponding to the Fabric type, and not the _Proxy or _Impl classes.
        Returns:
        the _Impl corresponding to clazz. If no _Impl class is found (i.e., clazz represents a Fabric interface), null is returned.

      • locateClass

        public static java.net.URL locateClass(java.lang.String className)
                                throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

      • chain

        public static <T> java.lang.Iterable<T> chain(java.lang.Iterable<T>... iters)

        Returns an iterable that iterates over the elements of the iterables passed in. The common use is: 

         for (T o : Utils.chain(a, b, c))
  o.f()
        which will call f() on each element of a, then each element of b, then each element of c.

        This is intended to be more efficient and easier than creating a new collection containing the contents.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the types of the elements of the iterables
        Parameters:
        iters - the iterables to chain
        Returns:
        an object that can be used to traverse iters in order

      • serialize
